meaning: road-way, street, district, journey, course, moral, teachings

onyomiExamples.meaning: road, path, street, route, way, set of practices, rules for conducting oneself, Buddhist teachings, Taoism, modern administrative region of Japan (Hokkaido), historical administrative region of Japan (Tokaido, Tosando, etc.), province (Tang-era administrative region of China), province (modern administrative region of Korea)
path of righteousness, path of duty, right track, correct path
being good, being virtuous, virtuous person
inhuman, immoral, unreasonable, outrageous, wicked, barbarity (one of the eight unpardonable crimes, incl. killing three people in one family, or dismembering a corpse)

kunyomiExamples.meaning: road, path, street, lane, passage, route, way, distance, journey, road (e.g. to victory), course, way (of living, proper conduct, etc.), moral principles, teachings (esp. Confucian or Buddhist), dogma, field (e.g. of medicine), subject, speciality, means, way, method
elevated walkway through the audience to the stage (kabuki), honourable end to a career
byway, side street, cross street, wrong way, digression
